alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 7:08PM CST until January 30 at 7:15AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria, Bloomington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River at Victoria. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.8 feet, Moderate flooding causes water to flow over Slayton Avenue and Memorial Drive, and starts flowing from the West Outfall toward Constitution and Craig Streets. Water is over Constitution and Craig Street and over areas west of Moody Street between Water and Constitution Streets. Water is also flowing over McCright and flowing into the golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 28.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CST Sunday was 28.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 7.4 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.9 feet on 03/17/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 28.9 Sun 6 pm 17.8 10.2 9.1 8.2 7.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
